page.title: 05Miss Bede
page.content: Miss Bede worked for 60 years and 4 days in The White Lion public house in{Bradninch.}Her recent book is entitled '60 Years behind Bars'. She attended the school in West End Road and left in 1918. She did not go to work for a while as she looked after her three brothers and sisters. The White Lion used to be a{coach house.}During the Second World {War,}she became a postwoman and her round was considerably large.She had two girl evacuees to stay, one of whom became a Headteacher. When Miss Bede left school, she received a medal saying she had attended school for one year. At{Christmas}time, a stick of holly served as a tree. A candle was tied on with string.She enjoyed meeting us at school and is a cheerful, lively and friendly Bradninch character.
